required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: The Aesthetic Surgery Education & Research Foundation

brief_summary.textblock: An increasing number of women are reporting a collection of non-specific systemic symptoms thought to be caused by their breast implants. There is no current pathophysiologic explanation or diagnostic test for BII; it is not a recognized medical disease at this time. This study aims to address the questions asked by patients, physicians, and the FDA with regard to the scientific validity of BII.

detailed_description.textblock: An increasing number of women are reporting a collection of non-specific systemic symptoms thought to be caused by their breast implants. The term Breast Implant Illness or "BII" originated with several social media groups. There is no current pathophysiologic explanation or diagnostic test for BII; it is not a recognized medical disease at this time. Recently several studies have been designed and funded to study the role of psychological and social behavioral factors. This study has been designed to scientifically analyze biospecimens from three cohorts of age matched women in the United States. This study aims to address the questions asked by patients, physicians, and the FDA with regard to the scientific validity of BII.

primary_outcome.description: Change in self-reported symptoms on validated questionnaires

clinical_study.condition: Women With Breast Implants Who May or May Not Have Systemic Symptoms
Women Undergoing an Elective Mastopexy (Breast Lift)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women with breast implants and self-reported symptoms of BII
arm_group.description: Women undergoing elective breast implant removal without replacement who self-report systemic symptons associated with BII

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women with breast implants and no self-reported BII
arm_group.description: Women undergoing elective breast implant exchange or removal without self-reported symptoms of BII
Women undergoing an elective mastopexy (breast lift) without breast implants or soft tissue support

intervention.description: Systemic blood and implant capsule tissue will be collected from two cohorts with breast implants, systemic blood only will be collected from Mastopexy cohort
intervention.arm_group_label: Women with breast implants and no self-reported BII
Women with breast implants and self-reported symptoms of BII

biospec_descr.textblock: Systemic blood, breast implant capsule tissue

study_pop.textblock: Genetic females between the ages of 30 and 65 who fall into one of the three cohorts.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: consecutive patients who present to investigator surgeon for 1) self-reported BII requesting explantation, 2) patient who presents for breast implant exchange or explantation without self-reported symptoms of BII, and 3) a patient who presents for a mastopexy(without implants or soft tissue support). Willingness to follow study requirements including 3-6 week and 6 month follow-up exams.
-
Exclusion Criteria: Genetic female, subject lives less than three hours away from the investigator surgeon, previous breast reconstruction for cancer, active malignancy anywhere else in the body, has been implanted with any silicone implant other than a breast implant anywhere else in the body, radiation, anti-estrogen therapy, HIV positive.
-

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Caroline Glicksman, MD and Patricia McGuire, MD

patient_data.ipd_description: Anticipated completion of biospecimen and qualitative data collection in 2020, with publication in the Aesthetic Surgery Journal
